{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head of Operations",
  "description": "U3u Security Services Limited&nbsp;is an indigenous private security company, who is out to provide topnotch security services to our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations

Job Location:&nbsp;Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Strategic Planning &amp; Policy Development: Develop and implement comprehensive security policies, procedures, and protocols to protect people, assets, and facilities.
	Personnel Management: Recruit, train, supervise, and develop the security operations team, ensuring they are competent and meet performance standards.
	Risk Management: Conduct regular risk assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and implement appropriate mitigation strategies.
	Operational Oversight: Manage daily security operations, including security guard deployment, event security, and the overall security posture of the company.
	Emergency Response: Develop and test emergency response plans, and coordinate responses to security incidents, breaches, and crises.
	Technology &amp; Systems Management: Oversee and maintain security systems and technologies, such as surveillance and access control systems.
	Budgeting &amp; Resource Allocation: Manage security budgets, monitor expenses, and optimize resource allocation to achieve financial and operational goals.
	Client Service: Deploy necessary resources to meet client needs, maintain a strong client base, and ensure quality service delivery.
	Compliance &amp; Reporting: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards, and prepare reports for senior management.


Key Skills &amp; Qualifications


	Certifications: Professional security management certifications such as CPP, CISSP, or CSMP are highly preferred.
	Experience: Significant experience in security management and operations, often with a Bachelor&#39;s degree in a relevant field.
	Leadership &amp; Communication: Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills to manage teams effectively and interact with stakeholders.
	Security Expertise: Deep understanding of security principles, current threats, and industry best practices.
	Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and execute strategic plans that align with organizational goals.
	Crisis Management: Proficiency in managing crises and coordinating responses to emergencies.
	Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills for assessing risks, monitoring performance, and identifying areas for improvement.
	Adaptability: Ability to work flexible hours and travel as needed to meet operational demands.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;U3urecruitment1@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",

Head of Operations Job at U3u Security Services Limited




        
    

        
        U3u Security Services Limited is an indigenous private security company, who is out to provide topnotch security services to our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations

Job Location: Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Strategic Planning & Policy Development: Develop and implement comprehensive security policies, procedures, and protocols to protect people, assets, and facilities.
	Personnel Management: Recruit, train, supervise, and develop the security operations team, ensuring they are competent and meet performance standards.
	Risk Management: Conduct regular risk assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and implement appropriate mitigation strategies.
	Operational Oversight: Manage daily security operations, including security guard deployment, event security, and the overall security posture of the company.
	Emergency Response: Develop and test emergency response plans, and coordinate responses to security incidents, breaches, and crises.
	Technology & Systems Management: Oversee and maintain security systems and technologies, such as surveillance and access control systems.
	Budgeting & Resource Allocation: Manage security budgets, monitor expenses, and optimize resource allocation to achieve financial and operational goals.
	Client Service: Deploy necessary resources to meet client needs, maintain a strong client base, and ensure quality service delivery.
	Compliance & Reporting: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards, and prepare reports for senior management.


Key Skills & Qualifications


	Certifications: Professional security management certifications such as CPP, CISSP, or CSMP are highly preferred.
	Experience: Significant experience in security management and operations, often with a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
	Leadership & Communication: Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills to manage teams effectively and interact with stakeholders.
	Security Expertise: Deep understanding of security principles, current threats, and industry best practices.
	Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and execute strategic plans that align with organizational goals.
	Crisis Management: Proficiency in managing crises and coordinating responses to emergencies.
	Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills for assessing risks, monitoring performance, and identifying areas for improvement.
	Adaptability: Ability to work flexible hours and travel as needed to meet operational demands.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: U3urecruitment1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Officer",
  "description": "U3u Security Services Limited&nbsp;is an indigenous innovative security company, out to provide topnotch security services to clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Human Resource Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Human Resources:


	Develop and update U3U Security Services Limited HR Policies as needed, in collaboration with Global Human Resources and ensure that staff are made aware of these policies and interpret them as necessary or requested by staff.
	Oversee the recruitment, selection and on boarding of all new staff.
	Process consultant contracts, including rate negotiation.
	Maintain all data base files.
	Maintain staff/operatives Personnel Files.
	Create and distribute guidelines and FAQ documents about company&rsquo;s policies.
	Prepare and update employment agreements ensuring that they are in keeping with local law and U3U practices.
	Negotiate salaries with approval from the management.
	Gather payroll data like bank accounts and work days.
	Publish and remove job ads.
	Schedule job interviews and contact candidates as needed.
	Prepare reports and presentations on HR-related metrics like total number of hires by department.
	Develop training and onboarding materials.
	Respond to employees&rsquo; questions about benefits (e.g. number of vacation days eligible for).


Admin/Logistics:


	Provide overall logistics and administrative support for smooth functioning of U3U Security Services Limited activities.
	Coordinate workshop/training events as required, including hotel liaison, invitations, travel arrangements, supplies &amp; materials, equipment hire and providing point of contact support for participants at events.
	Make travel and accommodation arrangements for personnel and consultant base on management approval.
	Arrange payment of utility and other routine bills and maintain track record of all these payments.
	Maintain local suppliers list both for routine and emergency supplies and conduct regular market surveys and update the list.
	Support/carryout procurement process as per U3U policies and procedures and forward the invoices/bills to Finance department for payment after verification and keep record of paid invoices in hard/soft.
	Maintain inventory database for assets and office supplies and conduct periodic inventory checks and submit inventory reconciliation reports to management on regular basis.
	Check vehicle log books and vehicle condition on regular basis.
	Maintain a proper/efficient filing system of office to ensure smooth running of the operations and maintain a repository of all logistics and administrative documents and their security.
	Support operations in formatting and designing documents for printing upon request from operation team.
	Supervise Admin staff (i.e. Office Assistants, Office Attendants, Drivers etc.) by monitoring performance of supervisee staff and give regular feedback to staff members and document corrective actions.
	Complete the annual performance appraisal, regular mentoring and coaching of supervisees.
	Manage office petty cash and ensure proper documentation is completed for reconciliation as per policy.
	Responsible to grow the business by 15%.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 4 years work experience.


Application Closing Date
30th&nbsp;September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send&nbsp;their CV&nbsp;and cover letter to:&nbsp;u3urecruitment1@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
Or
Submit by hand at;
The head Office,
U3u Security Services Limited,
Plot 109&nbsp;A line, Lagos Street,
Ewet Housing Estate,
Uyo, Akwa Ibom State.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",

    "@type": "Organization",

Human Resource Officer Job at U3u Security Services Limited




        
    

        
        U3u Security Services Limited is an indigenous innovative security company, out to provide topnotch security services to clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Human Resources:
     

            
    




	Develop and update U3U Security Services Limited HR Policies as needed, in collaboration with Global Human Resources and ensure that staff are made aware of these policies and interpret them as necessary or requested by staff.
	Oversee the recruitment, selection and on boarding of all new staff.
	Process consultant contracts, including rate negotiation.
	Maintain all data base files.
	Maintain staff/operatives Personnel Files.
	Create and distribute guidelines and FAQ documents about company’s policies.
	Prepare and update employment agreements ensuring that they are in keeping with local law and U3U practices.
	Negotiate salaries with approval from the management.
	Gather payroll data like bank accounts and work days.
	Publish and remove job ads.
	Schedule job interviews and contact candidates as needed.
	Prepare reports and presentations on HR-related metrics like total number of hires by department.
	Develop training and onboarding materials.
	Respond to employees’ questions about benefits (e.g. number of vacation days eligible for).


Admin/Logistics:


	Provide overall logistics and administrative support for smooth functioning of U3U Security Services Limited activities.
	Coordinate workshop/training events as required, including hotel liaison, invitations, travel arrangements, supplies & materials, equipment hire and providing point of contact support for participants at events.
	Make travel and accommodation arrangements for personnel and consultant base on management approval.
	Arrange payment of utility and other routine bills and maintain track record of all these payments.
	Maintain local suppliers list both for routine and emergency supplies and conduct regular market surveys and update the list.
	Support/carryout procurement process as per U3U policies and procedures and forward the invoices/bills to Finance department for payment after verification and keep record of paid invoices in hard/soft.
	Maintain inventory database for assets and office supplies and conduct periodic inventory checks and submit inventory reconciliation reports to management on regular basis.
	Check vehicle log books and vehicle condition on regular basis.
	Maintain a proper/efficient filing system of office to ensure smooth running of the operations and maintain a repository of all logistics and administrative documents and their security.
	Support operations in formatting and designing documents for printing upon request from operation team.
	Supervise Admin staff (i.e. Office Assistants, Office Attendants, Drivers etc.) by monitoring performance of supervisee staff and give regular feedback to staff members and document corrective actions.
	Complete the annual performance appraisal, regular mentoring and coaching of supervisees.
	Manage office petty cash and ensure proper documentation is completed for reconciliation as per policy.
	Responsible to grow the business by 15%.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 4 years work experience.


Application Closing Date
30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: u3urecruitment1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
Or
Submit by hand at;
The head Office,
U3u Security Services Limited,
Plot 109 A line, Lagos Street,
Ewet Housing Estate,
Uyo, Akwa Ibom State.    

    

        Click here to Apply

	Maintain accurate records of loan, savings and investment transactions and client communications in our loan management system

Supervisor Job at Teejay360 Multi Resources




        
    

        
        Teejay360 Multi Resources is committed to giving excellent loaning, savingsand investment services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supervisor
 Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Assist in reviewing and processing loan, savings and investment applications, ensuring all required documentation is complete and accurate
	Maintain accurate records of loan, savings and investment transactions and client communications in our loan management system
	Communicate effectively with clients to gather necessary information and provide updates on application status
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless loan processing and adherence to timelines
	Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes that may impact loan, savings and investment management


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field
	Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
	Smart and intelligent
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel
	Must live in Ikorodu.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and and any other document to: adamng2016@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fleet Officer",
  "description": "White Soul Group is a leading provider of logistics solutions and vehicle sales and after-sales services, dedicated to delivering excellence in every aspect of our business. We offer nationwide haulage, on-demand transport, fleet management, and secure transport services tailored for businesses. With a commitment to innovation, integrity, and customer satisfaction, we have become the trusted partner in logistics and automobile solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer
Job Locations:&nbsp;Cross River &amp; Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Fleet Officer will be responsible for overseeing the company&rsquo;s fleet of vehicles, ensuring they are properly maintained, effectively utilized, and compliant with all regulatory standards. This role requires a hands-on, detail-oriented individual with strong organizational and supervisory skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate and supervise the daily fleet operations to ensure timely and efficient service delivery.
	Monitor driver activities, vehicle usage, and fuel consumption to control costs and prevent misuse.
	Ensure that all vehicles are properly licensed, insured, and roadworthy at all times.
	Schedule preventive and corrective maintenance for all vehicles, ensuring minimal downtime.
	Track and analyze fleet performance using reports and fleet management tools.
	Conduct periodic driver training and safety checks to promote compliance with company and government regulations.
	Investigate accidents, incidents, and vehicle breakdowns, providing timely reports and recommendations.
	Maintain accurate records of vehicle documents, repairs, and operational expenses.
	Support the recruitment, onboarding, and performance monitoring of drivers.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	B.Sc. Degree / HND in Transport Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in fleet management or logistics operations.
	Strong knowledge of vehicle maintenance, transport laws, and safety regulations.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint); knowledge of fleet management software is an added advantage.
	Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Career development opportunities in a growing company.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;careers@whitesoulgroup.org&nbsp;using the Job Position and preferred location as the subject of the mail [e.g.: &ldquo;Fleet Officer - Calabar&quot;].",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "White Soul Group"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Cross River, Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "186922"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }

}



Fleet Officer Job at White Soul Group




        
    

        
        White Soul Group is a leading provider of logistics solutions and vehicle sales and after-sales services, dedicated to delivering excellence in every aspect of our business. We offer nationwide haulage, on-demand transport, fleet management, and secure transport services tailored for businesses. With a commitment to innovation, integrity, and customer satisfaction, we have become the trusted partner in logistics and automobile solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer
Job Locations: Cross River & Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Fleet Officer will be responsible for overseeing the company’s fleet of vehicles, ensuring they are properly maintained, effectively utilized, and compliant with all regulatory standards. This role requires a hands-on, detail-oriented individual with strong organizational and supervisory skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate and supervise the daily fleet operations to ensure timely and efficient service delivery.
	Monitor driver activities, vehicle usage, and fuel consumption to control costs and prevent misuse.
	Ensure that all vehicles are properly licensed, insured, and roadworthy at all times.
	Schedule preventive and corrective maintenance for all vehicles, ensuring minimal downtime.
	Track and analyze fleet performance using reports and fleet management tools.
	Conduct periodic driver training and safety checks to promote compliance with company and government regulations.
	Investigate accidents, incidents, and vehicle breakdowns, providing timely reports and recommendations.
	Maintain accurate records of vehicle documents, repairs, and operational expenses.
	Support the recruitment, onboarding, and performance monitoring of drivers.


Qualifications & Skills


	B.Sc. Degree / HND in Transport Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in fleet management or logistics operations.
	Strong knowledge of vehicle maintenance, transport laws, and safety regulations.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint); knowledge of fleet management software is an added advantage.
	Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Career development opportunities in a growing company.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@whitesoulgroup.org using the Job Position and preferred location as the subject of the mail [e.g.: “Fleet Officer - Calabar"].    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Manager",
  "description": "AM Consulting, an indigenous Hr Recruitment and consulting firm, located in Lagos, Nigeria, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Travel &amp; Tourism

Job Description


	We are seeking a dynamic Marketing Manager to lead brand visibility, drive impactful campaigns, and strengthen engagement with trade partners and customers across digital and offline channels.
	This role requires a strategic, commercially minded marketer with strong expertise in digital strategy, campaign management, and stakeholder engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Own and manage brand strategy and visibility across all subsidiaries.
	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies (SEO, social media, paid media, influencer marketing, content creation).
	Plan and manage data-driven campaigns, measuring ROI and performance across channels.
	Lead B2B and trade partner engagement through toolkits, campaigns, and events.
	Oversee Partner Plus Connect (PPC) events and other brand experiences.
	Create and optimize content (blogs, newsletters, videos, product explainers).
	Manage marketing budgets, performance reports, and analytics dashboards.
	Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver integrated campaigns.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Mass Communications, Marketing, or related field; MBA/professional certification is an advantage.
	Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience (2 years in a supervisory role).
	Proven track record in brand and digital marketing, B2B engagement, and campaign execution.
	Strong knowledge of CRM tools, analytics platforms, SEO/SEM, and social media trends.
	Excellent communication, project management, and leadership skills.
	Experience in the travel industry is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrspace011@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Marketing Manager&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-04",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "AM Consulting"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

    }

Marketing Manager Job at AM Consulting




        
    

        
        AM Consulting, an indigenous Hr Recruitment and consulting firm, located in Lagos, Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Travel & Tourism

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic Marketing Manager to lead brand visibility, drive impactful campaigns, and strengthen engagement with trade partners and customers across digital and offline channels.
	This role requires a strategic, commercially minded marketer with strong expertise in digital strategy, campaign management, and stakeholder engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Own and manage brand strategy and visibility across all subsidiaries.
	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies (SEO, social media, paid media, influencer marketing, content creation).
	Plan and manage data-driven campaigns, measuring ROI and performance across channels.
	Lead B2B and trade partner engagement through toolkits, campaigns, and events.
	Oversee Partner Plus Connect (PPC) events and other brand experiences.
	Create and optimize content (blogs, newsletters, videos, product explainers).
	Manage marketing budgets, performance reports, and analytics dashboards.
	Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver integrated campaigns.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mass Communications, Marketing, or related field; MBA/professional certification is an advantage.
	Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience (2 years in a supervisory role).
	Proven track record in brand and digital marketing, B2B engagement, and campaign execution.
	Strong knowledge of CRM tools, analytics platforms, SEO/SEM, and social media trends.
	Excellent communication, project management, and leadership skills.
	Experience in the travel industry is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrspace011@gmail.com using “Marketing Manager” as the subject of the mail.
